sn2.26:1.2: Rohitassa means “red horse”. Originally the red steed of Agni, “swift as the wind” (Rig Veda 1.94.10), later _rohitāśva_ became a name for Agni himself.
sn2.26:3.1: Bhoja was a land in the Vindhya ranges.
sn2.26:3.6: Note that the phrase evarūpena javena samannāgatassa evarūpena ca padavītihārena is in the previous segment in the AN version.
sn2.26:5.1: repetition of previous segment apparently omitted by mistake.
sn2.26:5.2: This echoes Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 1.2.5.14 and 7.1.1.37, where the fire altar is measured out as a fathom (_vyāmamātra_) for this is the length of a human. The altar and the human person encompass the whole world.
